intro: Conyza kahuzica, commonly known as the African dandelion, is an annual herbaceous plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a serrated margin. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces lightweight seeds that are easily dispersed by the wind. Conyza kahuzica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
